title: `let_chains` introduces an error in move analysis
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

The following code runs without errors:

```rust
fn main() {
    struct S;
    let x: Option<S> = Some(S);
    if let Some(s) = x { Some(s) } else { x };
}
```

But the following code produces an error:
```rust
#![feature(let_chains)]
fn main() {
    struct S;
    let x: Option<S> = Some(S);
    if let Some(s) = x && true { Some(s) } else { x };
}
```

```
error[E0382]: use of partially moved value: `x`
 --> src/main.rs:5:51
  |
5 |     if let Some(s) = x && true { Some(s) } else { x };
  |                 - value partially moved here      ^ value used here after partial move
  |
  = note: partial move occurs because value has type `S`, which does not implement the `Copy` trait
help: borrow this field in the pattern to avoid moving `x.0`
  |
5 |     if let Some(ref s) = x && true { Some(s) } else { x };
  |                 +++
```

I expected to see the same result for the second case because `&& true` part doesn't affect move analysis.

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.67.0-nightly (77e57db38 2022-10-30)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 77e57db384aca99444c3b5f6a9c86bc58a804d89
commit-date: 2022-10-30
host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 1.67.0-nightly
LLVM version: 15.0.4
```
